Question: In January 2008, this person publicly came out against Republican candidate John McCain and endorsed Mitt Romney for President.
Hints: This person's running mate was retired Vice Admiral James Stockdale, a highly-decorated former Vietnam prisoner of war (POW).
This person was late in making formal policy proposals, but most of what he did call for were intended to reduce the deficit.
Jamin B Raskin of Open Debates filed a lawsuit on this person's behalf on this assumption.
